verbs.description: [ARG0: army veteran company] [V: releases] ‘ [ARG1: just stand’] [ARG1: t - shirt] [ARGM-LOC: in opposition to nike colin kaepernick ads] army veteran tyler merritt company nine line apparel is releasing a t - shirt that reads just stand in opposition to nike new just do it campaign featuring colin kaepernick https twitter com ninelineapparel status 1037467854231281665 kaepernick is the former nfl quarterback who started a trend of protesting police violence and racial inequality in america by kneeling during the national anthem at games although it spread throughout the league and other players participated kaepernick has faced backlash from critics who maintain the protest is disrespectful to the country among his critics are president donald trump kaepernick is also involved in a lawsuit that alleges the nfl is colluding to keep him out of the league because of the protests why did he do it they decided to take a stance this is our stand merritt a former army captain and ceo of nine line told fox news on saturday nike agreement with kaepernick includes his own apparel line video ads billboards with his … nine line apparel army kaepernick nike tyler merritt nine line donald trump national football league colin kaepernick
